article.title: Corrections to (pseudo)scalars decay into a fermion pair from gravitational torsion

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical process is depicted in Figure 1?
choices: Annihilation of a fermion-antifermion pair into a scalar particle.
Decay of a scalar particle into a fermion pair through a four-fermion interaction.
Scattering of two scalar particles mediated by a fermion loop.
Production of a scalar particle in association with a fermion-antifermion pair.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the effective Lagrangian term  *L<sub>AFI</sub>* in Formula (9) represent?
choices: The kinetic term for the Dirac fields.
The Yukawa interaction between the scalar field and fermions.
The induced four-fermion contact interaction due to gravitational torsion.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 2(a), what trend is observed for the Higgs boson branching ratio variation (δBr<sup>4FI</sup>) as the gravitational scale (Λ) increases?
choices: δBr<sup>4FI</sup> remains constant with increasing Λ.
The condition for CP violation in the 2HDM.
The constraint on the Yukawa couplings in the SM.
The condition to distinguish between scalar and pseudoscalar corrections to the decay width.
The formula for the Higgs boson mass in the 2HDM.
